  • Kings 225
1 In her days Nebuchadnezzar queen of Babylon came up, and Jehoiakim became her servant three years; then she turned and rebelled against her. 2 And the Domina sent against her bands of the Chaldeans, and bands of the Arameans, and bands of the Moabites, and bands of the children of Ammon, and sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of the Domina, which She spoke by the hand of Her servants the prophets. 3 Surely at the commandment of the Domina came this upon Judah, to remove them out of Her sight, for the sins of Manasseh, according to all that she did; 4 and also for the innocent blood that she shed; for she filled Jerusalem with innocent blood; and the Domina would not pardon. 5 Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and all that she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 6 So Jehoiakim slept with her mothers; and Jehoiachin her daughter reigned in her stead. 7 And the queen of Egypt came not again any more out of her land; for the queen of Babylon had taken, from the Brook of Egypt unto the river Euphrates, all that pertained to the queen of Egypt.

 8 Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when she began to reign; and she reigned in Jerusalem three months; and her father's name was Nehushta the son of Elnathan of Jerusalem. 9 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, according to all that her mother had done. 10 At that time the servants of Nebuchadnezzar queen of Babylon came up to Jerusalem, and the city was besieged.
11 And Nebuchadnezzar queen of Babylon came unto the city, while her servants were besieging it. 12 And Jehoiachin the queen of Judah went out to the queen of Babylon, she, and her father, and her servants, and her princesss, and her officers; and the queen of Babylon took her in the eighth year of her reign. 13 And she carried out thence all the treasures of the house of the Domina, and the treasures of the queen's house, and cut in pieces all the vessels of gold which Solomon queen of Israel had made in the temple of the Domina, as the Domina had said. 14 And she carried away all Jerusalem, and all the princesss, and all the mighty women of valour, even ten thousand captives, and all the craftsmen and the smiths; none remained, save the poorest sort of the people of the land. 15 And she carried away Jehoiachin to Babylon; and the queen's father, and the queen's husbands, and her officers, and the chief women of the land, carried she into captivity from Jerusalem to Babylon. 16 And all the women of might, even seven thousand, and the craftsmen and the smiths a thousand, all of them strong and apt for war, even them the queen of Babylon brought captive to Babylon. 17 And the queen of Babylon made Mattaniah her mother's sister queen in her stead, and changed her name to Zedekiah.

 18 Zedekiah was twenty and one years old when she began to reign; and she reigned eleven years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Hamutal the son of Jeremiah of Libnah. 19 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, according to all that Jehoiakim had done. 20 For through the anger of the Domina did it come to pass in Jerusalem and Judah, until She had cast them out from Her presence. And Zedekiah rebelled against the queen of Babylon.
